confirmed_facts: 44 UN member states issued a joint statement on 24â€¯Novemberâ€¯2025 expressing deep concern over the surge of onlineâ€‘scamâ€‘based human trafficking.
The statement was prepared and led by the Korean government and read by Ambassador ì°¨ì§€í›ˆ at the UN Headquarters in Newâ€¯York.
The joint declaration was made ahead of the UN General Assemblyâ€™s highâ€‘level meeting on human trafficking.
The statement highlights that online scams and transnational organized crime are expanding digitalâ€‘based human trafficking networks, exposing victims to forced labour and sexual exploitation.
